text.content:
Skills & Ability Checks

Using your abilities to accomplish tasks

Ability Checks

Roll 1d20 + ability modifier + proficiency bonus (if proficient)

DC (Difficulty Class): Typical DCs:

  • Very Easy: DC 5
  • Easy: DC 10
  • Medium: DC 15
  • Hard: DC 20
  • Very Hard: DC 25
  • Nearly Impossible: DC 30

The 18 Core Skills

Strength Skills

  • Athletics: Climbing, jumping, swimming, grappling

Dexterity Skills

  • Acrobatics: Balance, tumbling, aerial maneuvers
  • Sleight of Hand: Pickpocketing, concealing objects, tricks
  • Stealth: Hiding, moving silently

Intelligence Skills

  • Arcana: Knowledge of magic, spells, magical items
  • History: Knowledge of historical events, legends
  • Investigation: Finding clues, deducing information
  • Nature: Knowledge of terrain, plants, animals, weather
  • Religion: Knowledge of deities, rituals, religious symbols

Wisdom Skills

  • Animal Handling: Calming, training, understanding animals
  • Insight: Reading emotions, detecting lies, predicting behavior
  • Medicine: Diagnosing illness, stabilizing dying creatures
  • Perception: Spotting, hearing, detecting things
  • Survival: Tracking, foraging, navigating wilderness

Charisma Skills

  • Deception: Lying convincingly, disguising intent
  • Intimidation: Influencing through threats or hostile actions
  • Performance: Entertaining through music, dance, acting
  • Persuasion: Influencing through tact, respect, good nature

Saving Throws

Roll 1d20 + ability modifier + proficiency bonus (if proficient in that save)

Made to resist spells, traps, poisons, diseases, and other threats.

The Six Saving Throws

  • Strength: Resisting being moved or physically forced
  • Dexterity: Dodging out of harm's way
  • Constitution: Enduring poison, disease, death
  • Intelligence: Resisting mental effects that confuse logic
  • Wisdom: Resisting effects that deceive senses
  • Charisma: Asserting your identity against magical transformation

Passive Checks

Formula: 10 + all modifiers that apply to the check

Used when the DM wants to determine if characters succeed without rolling (especially Perception and Insight).
